definition: to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
the first step is the hardest (idiom)

sentences.english: ' he said, raising his head from the arm of the great chair, in which he reclined.
sentences.chinese: 他说，从他靠着的大椅子扶手上抬起头来。

sentences.english: It was; she lifted her head and smiled.
sentences.chinese: 是的，重复了，她抬起头来笑了。

sentences.english: The machine gun hailed over our heads.
sentences.chinese: 机关枪的火力压得我们抬不起头来。

sentences.english: Melinda and Steve looked up fearfully when Veach walked in.
sentences.chinese: 维克走进屋时，梅林达和史蒂夫惊恐地抬起头来。

sentences.english: When I looked up, the teacher was looking at me.
sentences.chinese: 当我抬起头来，老师是望着我。

sentences.english: After picnic the children begin to fly kites. Mr. and Mr. Jackson go fishing by the lake.
sentences.chinese: 午餐后孩子们起头放风筝，杰克逊佳耦在湖边垂钓。

sentences.english: And in humble people, often from sad ziqi, lift head.
sentences.chinese: 而穿着简陋的人，常常自悲自弃，抬不起头。

sentences.english: In 1828, he began to get advanced education.
Honestly, you go where sufficient affordable are carried head.
sentences.chinese: 问心无愧，已足够你走到哪里都抬得起头。

sentences.english: He caught the mixture of surprise and pensiveness in her voice and looked up immediately.
sentences.chinese: 他听出她声音中惊奇夹着沉思，立即抬起头来。

sentences.english: The highly anticipated dates sold out almost immediately when tickets went on sale.
sentences.chinese: 当备受等候的售票日起头时，门票几乎当即发卖一空。
那个胆小的男人抬起头来。

sentences.english: I am resolved to try story-writing but so far have not made a start.
sentences.chinese: 我下决心试试小说写作，不外迄今为止还没起头。

sentences.english: Linnet lifted her head and stared at him.
sentences.chinese: 林内特抬起头来凝视着他。

sentences.english: Horton looked up with his face white as chalk.
sentences.chinese: 可怜的霍顿脸色煞白，抬起头来。

definition: to lift/to raise/(of two or more persons) to carry
to raise one's head/to perk up
to face upward/to look up/to admire/to rely on
to shake (a part of one's body)/to shrug (shoulders)/to create a sensation/to incite
